stimulus:
In this experiment, you will be presented with 8 scenarios, which you must read carefully.

After reading each scenario, you will be prompted two comprehension questions: a multiple choice question and a brief open answer question. You will be required to answer both questions for every scenario, meaning 16 questions in total.

To begin the experiment, hit the space bar.

response.Explanation: I think Olivia's replies was a genuine compliment. I don't seem to find any form of sarcasm in her response. Alice might not like the hairstyle, but it might look good on her still.
Jane would read Catherine's message as trying to explain that she feels perfectly well enough to gym and she doesn't need to worry about her
I think Anastasia recognizes Jack does not bake, but she appreciates his effort.
Margaret respond was sarcastic because of her experience with bulldogs. She probably is telling Julia that no matter how cute your puppy is, I hate dogs!!!
Lols...that was obviously a sarcastic remark as Phillip didn't like the jacket. He showed that when he scoffs after seeing the jacket during the interview.
I think Spencer genuinely mean what he said about Spencer in the letter as he enjoys his company. Children always fight and makeup.
Ana genuinely believe that James is a good person as the is still fond of him, and still made him her good friend.

Even though she did not eventually express her love to Kate, I think she genuinely enjoyed the trip. Their conversation and time spent together during the trip was obviously enjoyable. Her remark about Kate was sincere.
